name: Necrobiotic Xanthogranuloma with Paraproteinemia
chief_complaint: Painful yellow-orange patches on my face and legs that won't heal
physical_findings: Indurated xanthomatous plaques with central atrophy
prognosis: Chronic progressive course with potential for systemic involvement; 5-year mortality rate of 15-20% due to hematologic complications
description: A rare non-Langerhans cell histiocytosis characterized by cutaneous xanthomatous lesions associated with paraproteinemia. Pathogenesis involves abnormal macrophage activation and granuloma formation with necrobiotic changes. Typically affects middle-aged adults with systemic manifestations including hematologic abnormalities and ocular involvement.
